events.originalText: Croatia held a referendum, in which it voted to become a member of the European Union.
events.subtitle: 2012 Croatian European Union membership referendum
events.headline: Croatia Votes to Join EU

events.originalText: After being convicted of receiving bribes, Pennsylvania state treasurer R. Budd Dwyer shot and killed himself in front of television cameras during a press conference.
events.subtitle: Bribery
events.headline: PA State Treasurer Commits Suicide on Live TV

events.originalText: During Super Bowl XVIII, Apple Computer introduced the Macintosh, the first successful personal computer to use a graphical user interface, with the television commercial "1984".
events.subtitle: Super Bowl XVIII
events.headline: Apple Introduces Macintosh During Super Bowl XVIII

events.originalText: Uganda–Tanzania War: After surrounding Mutukula the previous day, Tanzanian forces attacked the town in the Battle of Mutukula and caused Ugandan forces to flee.
events.subtitle: Uganda–Tanzania War
events.headline: Tanzanian Forces Attack Ugandan Town in War

events.originalText: The U.S. Supreme Court delivered a landmark decision in Roe v. Wade, striking down laws restricting abortion during the first two trimesters of pregnancy.
events.subtitle: Supreme Court of the United States
events.headline: Supreme Court Rules on Roe v. Wade

events.originalText: The Boeing 747, the world's first wide-body commercial airliner, entered service for Pan Am on the New York–London route.
events.subtitle: Boeing 747
events.headline: Boeing 747 Enters Service for Pan Am

events.originalText: Soviet leader Leonid Brezhnev survived what was seen as an assassination attempt, an incident that was not revealed to the public until after the fall of the Soviet Union.
events.subtitle: Leonid Brezhnev
events.headline: Brezhnev Survives Assassination Attempt

events.originalText: Apollo 5 (pictured), the first flight of NASA's Lunar Module, lifted off from Cape Kennedy Air Force Station.
events.subtitle: Apollo 5
events.headline: Apollo 5 Launches Lunar Module

events.originalText: France and West Germany signed the Élysée Treaty, establishing a new foundation for relations that ended centuries of rivalry.
events.subtitle: Élysée Treaty
events.headline: France and West Germany Sign Élysée Treaty

events.originalText: New York City police arrested George Metesky, better known as the "Mad Bomber", for planting over 30 bombs over 16 years throughout the city.
events.subtitle: New York City Police Department
events.headline: NYC Police Arrest 'Mad Bomber'

events.originalText: World War II: The Battle of Buna–Gona on New Guinea ended with an Allied victory after two months of fighting in which the Japanese fought with a resolve and tenacity not previously encountered.
events.subtitle: World War II
events.headline: Allies Win Battle of Buna–Gona in WWII

events.originalText: World War II: The Battle of Buna–Gona on New Guinea ended with an Allied victory after two months of difficult fighting against well-prepared Japanese defence.
events.subtitle: World War II
events.headline: Allies Claim Victory in Battle of Buna–Gona

events.originalText: Ramsay MacDonald took office as the first prime minister of the United Kingdom from the Labour Party.
events.subtitle: Ramsay MacDonald
events.headline: Ramsay MacDonald Becomes UK's First Labour PM

events.originalText: SS Valencia  was wrecked off the coast of Vancouver Island, Canada, in a location so treacherous it was known as the Graveyard of the Pacific.
events.subtitle: SS Valencia
events.headline: SS Valencia Wrecked off Vancouver Island

events.originalText: The Convention Parliament met to decide the fate of the throne after James II, the last Catholic monarch of England, fled to France following the Glorious Revolution.
events.subtitle: Convention Parliament (1689)
events.headline: Convention Parliament Decides Fate After James II Flees

events.originalText: Muhammad II became Sultan of Granada after his father's death in a riding accident.
events.subtitle: Muhammad II of Granada
events.headline: Muhammad II Becomes Sultan of Granada

events.originalText: Eutychius, Ecumenical Patriarch of Constantinople, was arrested after he refused Byzantine emperor Justinian I's order to adopt the tenets of the Aphthartodocetae, a sect of non-Chalcedonian Christians.
events.subtitle: Eutychius of Constantinople
events.headline: Ecumenical Patriarch of Constantinople Arrested
